conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The v-t graph shows Car A with a constant velocity of 40 m/s and Car B with a linear increase in velocity starting from rest.
Car A and Car B are side by side at t=30s.
The v-t graph shows Car B accelerating uniformly.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s.
Car B starts from rest and accelerates uniformly.
The slope of the v-t graph for Car B gives its acceleration.
The acceleration of Car B is 2 m/s².
The position function for Car A is x_A(t) = 40t.
The position function for Car B is x_B(t) = t².
Car A and Car B are side by side at t=30s.
Set x_A(t) = x_B(t) to find the times when they are side by side.
Solving t² - 40t = 0 gives t = 0 or t = 40 seconds.
The distance between the cars is Δx(t) = 40t - t².
The maximum distance occurs at the vertex of the quadratic function Δx(t) = -t² + 40t.
The vertex of Δx(t) = -t² + 40t is at t = 20 seconds.
Substituting t = 20 into Δx(t) gives the maximum distance.
